1.text: The words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him.

2.text: What, my son? and what, the son of my womb? and what, the son of my vows?

3.text: Give not your strength to women, nor your ways to that which destroys kings.

4.text: It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes strong drink:

5.text: Lest they drink, and forget the law, and pervert the judgment of any of the afflicted.

6.text: Give strong drink to him that is ready to perish, and wine to those that be of heavy hearts.

7.text: Let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.

8.text: Open your mouth for the dumb in the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction.

9.text: Open your mouth, judge righteously, and plead the cause of the poor and needy.

10.text: Who can find a virtuous woman? for her price is far above rubies.

11.text: The heart of her husband does safely trust in her, so that he shall have no need of spoil.

12.text: She will do him good and not evil all the days of her life.

13.text: She seeks wool, and flax, and works willingly with her hands.

14.text: She is like the merchantsâ€™ ships; she brings her food from afar.

15.text: She rises also while it is yet night, and gives meat to her household, and a portion to her maidens.

16.text: She considers a field, and buys it: with the fruit of her hands she plants a vineyard.

17.text: She girds her loins with strength, and strengthens her arms.

18.text: She perceives that her merchandise is good: her candle goes not out by night.

19.text: She lays her hands to the spindle, and her hands hold the distaff.

20.text: She stretches out her hand to the poor; yes, she reaches forth her hands to the needy.

21.text: She is not afraid of the snow for her household: for all her household are clothed with scarlet.

22.text: She makes herself coverings of tapestry; her clothing is silk and purple.

23.text: Her husband is known in the gates, when he sits among the elders of the land.

24.text: She makes fine linen, and sells it; and delivers girdles to the merchant.

25.text: Strength and honor are her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come.

26.text: She opens her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue is the law of kindness.

27.text: She looks well to the ways of her household, and eats not the bread of idleness.

28.text: Her children arise up, and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praises her.

29.text: Many daughters have done virtuously, but you excel them all.

30.text: Favor is deceitful, and beauty is vain: but a woman that fears the LORD, she shall be praised.

31.text: Give her of the fruit of her hands; and let her own works praise her in the gates.
